text: Father André Prost (born August 28, 1903 in Orgelet, Jura; died May 24, 1987 in Bry-sur-Marne) was a French missionary, Africanist, and linguist.André et Dominique Prost, « André Prost (1903-1987), missionnaire et linguiste africain au service de la Haute-Volta : Repères biographiques », in Gabriel Massa et Y. Georges Madiéga (dir.), La Haute-Volta coloniale : témoignages, recherches, regards, Éd. Karthala, Paris, 1995, p. 582-583. (in French) As a White Father, he was a member of the Société des africanistes since 1932, and was a founding member of the Société des linguistes de l'Afrique occidentale (SLAO). He is the author of some fifty books and articles on the languages of West Africa.IdRef. ==References== ==External links== *Publications on Persée Category:1903 births Category:1987 deaths Category:Linguists from France Category:Linguists of Niger–Congo languages Category:Missionary linguists Category:White Fathers Category:French Africanists Category:20th-century linguists
